sentence: Did you hear about the explosion in the cheese factory? the only thing left was de-brie
explanation: The joke plays on debris, which means the scattered pieces of something broken or destroyed, and de-brie, which humorously connects to brie, a type of cheese.
first_new_sentence: The construction crew had to clear the debris after the storm damaged the building.
second_new_sentence: The cheese was left out too long and became quite de-brie.

sentence: What does a tree do when it wants to go home? it leaves.
explanation: The joke plays on leaves, meaning the foliage on a tree and also meaning to depart or go away.
first_new_sentence: The leaves turned golden in autumn, creating a beautiful scenery.
second_new_sentence: After the long meeting, I decided it was time to leave.

sentence: Why did the devil buy so many shoes? he wanted their soles.
explanation: The joke plays on soles, referring to the bottom part of shoes and also a pun on souls, referencing spiritual beings.
first_new_sentence: The soles of my shoes wore out quickly while hiking.
second_new_sentence: The philosopher pondered the existence of souls and their purpose.
